trans-unit.source:
\n

Contains information about the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
A string that contains a two-letter code defined in ISO 3166 for country/region.

-or-

A string that contains the culture name for a specific culture, custom culture, or Windows-only culture.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx x xxx$xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx XXX 0000 xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$X xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xx Xxxxxxx$xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: If the culture name is not in RFC 4646 format, your application should specify the entire culture name instead of just the country/region.
trans-unit.target: Xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xx XXX 0000 xxxxxx$ xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: name is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: name is not a valid country/region name or specific culture name.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx xxx x xxxxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the currency symbol associated with the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The currency symbol associated with the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the full name of the country/region in the language of the localized version of .NET Framework.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx .XXX Xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The full name of the country/region in the language of the localized version of .NET Framework.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx .XXX Xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the full name of the country/region in English.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The full name of the country/region in English.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the country/region uses the metric system for measurements.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the country/region uses the metric system for measurements; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the three-character ISO 4217 currency symbol associated with the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxx$xxxxxxxxx XXX 0000 xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The three-character ISO 4217 currency symbol associated with the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx$xxxxxxxxx XXX 0000 xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of a country/region formatted in the native language of the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The native name of the country/region formatted in the language associated with the ISO 3166 country/region code.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx XXX 0000 xxxxxxx$xxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the two-letter code defined in ISO 3166 for the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxx$xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx XXX 0000 xxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The two-letter code defined in ISO 3166 for the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx$xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx XXX 0000 xxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x
